intro: Clematis coriigera, commonly known as the European clematis, is a deciduous vine native to Europe and western Asia. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its stems are twining and can grow up to 10 meters long, making it a vigorous climber. Clematis coriigera prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
